alert.note: Alert for Baker; Mitchell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 9:24AM EDT until April 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at Newton (SR 37) affecting Mitchell and Baker Counties. For the Flint River...including Albany, Newton (SR 37), Bainbridge (US 27)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River at Newton (SR 37). * WHEN...From late Sunday night to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning to a crest of 25.1 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM EDT.
